columns.text: In this problem, we will compare the industry average price-to-earnings ratio and that of Ragan, Inc.

For Ragan, Inc., we can also solve for its price-earnings ratio using the same formula above. Recall that the stock price of this company is $\$54.26$ while its earnings per share is $\$3.15$.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Price-earnings ratio}&=\dfrac{\$54.25}{\$3.15}\\[15 pt]
&=17.22
\end{aligned}$$

As we can see from the values, we can conclude that Ragan, Inc;, has a lower price-earnings ratio compared to the standard. This means that this company is less valuable than the average company in the same industry. 

This is expected of Ragan, Inc., since it appears that they grew their company too quickly, which means they almost exhausted all innovations that could have propelled them to being more profitable.
